app will have in PM2 script string â€œbin/app.jsâ€ path of your app args list [â€œâ€“enable-logsâ€, â€œ-nâ€, â€œ15â€] arguments given to your app when it is launched node_args list [â€œâ€“harmonyâ€, â€œâ€“max-stack-size=1024â€] arguments given to node when it is launched cwd string â€œ/var/www/app/prodâ€ the directory from which your app will be launched exec_mode string â€œclusterâ€ â€œforkâ€ mode is used by default, â€œclusterâ€ mode can be configured with instances field instances number 4 number of instances for your clustered app, 0 means as much instances as you have CPU cores. a negative value means CPU cores - value (e.g -1 on a 4 cores machine will spawn 3 instances) exec_interpreter string â€œnodeâ€ defaults to â€œnodeâ€. can be â€œpythonâ€, â€œrubyâ€, â€œbashâ€ or whatever interpreter you wish to use. â€œnoneâ€ will execute your app as a binary executable log_date_format string â€œYYYY-MM-DD HH:mm Zâ€ format in which timestamps will be displayed in the logs error_file string â€œ/var/log/node-app/node-app.stderr.logâ€ path to the specified error log file. PM2 generates one by default if not specified and you can find it by typing pm2 desc <app id> out_file string â€œ/var/log/node-app/node-app.stdout.logâ€ path to the specified output log file. PM2 generates one by default if not specified and you can find it by typing pm2 desc <app id> pid_file string â€œpids/node-geo-api.pidâ€ path to the specified pid file. PM2 generates one by default if not specified and you can find it by typing pm2 desc <app id> merge_logs boolean false defaults to false. if true, it will merge logs from all instances of the same app into the same file cron_restart string â€œ1 0 * * *â€ a cron pattern to restart your app. only works in â€œclusterâ€ mode for now. soon to be avaible in â€œforkâ€ mode as well watch boolean true enables the watch feature, defaults to â€œfalseâ€. if true, it will restart your app everytime a file change is detected on the folder or subfolder of your app. ignore_watch list [â€œ[\/\\ ]\./â€œ, â€œnode_modulesâ€] list of regex to ignore some file or folder names by the watch feature min_uptime number 1000 min uptime of the app to be considered started (i.e. if the app crashes in this time frame, the app will only be restarted the number set in max_restarts (default 15), after that itâ€™s errored) max_restarts number 10 number of consecutive unstable restarts (less than 1sec interval or custom time via min_uptime) before your app is considered errored and stop being max_memory_restart string â€œ150Mâ€ your app will be restarted by PM2 if it exceeds the amount of memory specified. human-friendly format : it can be â€œ10Mâ€, â€œ100Kâ€, â€œ2Gâ€ and so onâ€¦ env object {â€œNODE_ENVâ€: â€œproductionâ€, â€œIDâ€: â€œ42â€} env variables which will appear in your app autorestart boolean false true by default. if false, PM2 will not restart your app if it crashes or ends peacefully vizion boolean false true by default. if false, PM2 will start without vizion features (versioning control metadatas) post_update list [â€œnpm installâ€, â€œecho launching the appâ€] a list of commands which will be executed after you perform a Pull/Upgrade operation from Keymetrics dashboard force boolean true defaults to false. if true, you can start the same script several times which is usually not allowed by PM2 next_gen_js boolean true defaults to false. if true, PM2 will launch your app using embedded BabelJS features which means you can run ES6/ES7 javascript code restart_delay number 4000 time to wait before restarting a crashed app (in milliseconds). defaults to 0.
